definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: They might suck their thumb, seek out a blanket or so on.
sentences.chinese: 吮大拇指，或是去寻找毯子之类的。

sentences.english: If I roll it up, my blanket can change into a pillow.
sentences.chinese: 如果我把它卷起来，我的毯子能变成一个枕头。

sentences.english: I went over to hold Eden. The stripes on her blanket were green.
sentences.chinese: 我上前抱住了伊甸，包裹她的小毯子是白底绿纹的。

sentences.english: The girl burrowed under the blankets.
Acrylic blankets and shawls are both warm and washable.
sentences.chinese: 丙烯酸纤维的毯子和围巾又保暖又耐洗。

sentences.english: The stewardess kindly brought me a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 女乘务员体贴地给我拿来了毯子。

sentences.english: He rolled himself up in a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 他用一条毯子把自己裹起来。

sentences.english: At midnight he pulled the blanket over him.
sentences.chinese: 到半夜时他拉过毯子盖在身上。

sentences.english: Take a thread and weave a blanket, that’s what he used to say.
sentences.chinese: 抽出根线头，织出条毯子，他经常这么说的。

sentences.english: He had worn through the blanket- wrappings , and his feet were shapeless lumps of raw meat.
sentences.chinese: 脚下裹的毯子都磨穿了，脚也被磨得没一处好肉。

sentences.english: He was given only a wooden pallet with a blanket.
sentences.chinese: 只给了他一张硬板小床和一条毯子。

sentences.english: He was pulling at my blankets and barking.
One of the biggest disrupters of sleep is the pulling and tugging of sheets and blankets.
sentences.chinese: 俩人一块儿睡的时候，最烦的就是拉被单和揪毯子了。

sentences.english: With a malicious crackle the old man held up a small white swaddling garment.
sentences.chinese: 老头啪一声狠狠扯下毯子上的一个白色的小装饰。

sentences.english: This is a warm blanket, not like that thin one.
sentences.chinese: 这条毯子暖和，不像那条薄的。

sentences.english: One lady had a bathrobe around her. Others just had blankets around them.
sentences.chinese: 一位女士只穿着一件睡衣，其他人只围着一条毯子。
